data.name: Misery Street
data.detailed_description:
Emo, a lonely teenager, has decided to run away from home and walk Misery Street in pursuit of meaning. But the street brings out the worst within ones-self. Emo will have to overcome a world of delusional foes as well as the demons from his past.

GAMEPLAY FEATURES

  • Playtime of about 20+ hours with a unique NewGame+.
  • The game will offer a linear path that can be completely ignored.
  • A lot of optional text for those who wish to immerse themselves in the lore-rich world and characters.
  • Very little mandatory text for those who just want to experience the gameplay and story.
  • Balanced battles will force you to make critical decisions that should challenge even veteran players, but do not require deep RPG knowledge so they can be beaten by newcomers as well.
  • A wide variety of weapons, skills, and armor that each has wildly different effects.
  • A classic turn-based RPG experience with modern mechanics featuring autosaving, no grinding, visible overworld monsters, and more.
  • A shy companion to talk to and bond with. Your relationship may affect the events to come.

If you experience a lot of lag, please try the Lag Free Beta branch.

data.short_description: Take the role of an angsty teenager and explore a huge retro fantasy world.

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: OS Microsoft® Windows® XP / Vista / 7 (32-bit/64-bit)
  • Processor: Intel® Pentium® 4 2.0 GHz equivalent or faster processor
  • Memory: 512 MB RAM
  • Graphics: 1024 x 768 pixels or higher desktop resolution
  • Storage: 400 MB available space
  • Sound Card: Yes

mac_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Mac OSX 10.10 or better
  • Processor: Intel Core2 Duo or better
  • Memory: 1 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Compatible OpenGLR
  • Storage: 400 MB available space
  • Sound Card: Yes

linux_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Ubuntu 12.04 or higher
  • Processor: 2 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Radeon HD 2400 or comparable
  • Additional Notes: Anything supporting OpenGL 2.0 should work in theory

content_descriptors.notes: Depictions of drug and alcohol abuse, self-harm, suicide and violence.
